The paragraph is about laboratory techniques (immuno/histochemistry and electron microscopy) being performed on the cerebellum of offspring, and the measurement of malondialdehyde and superoxide dismutase levels. Malondialdehyde is a marker for oxidative stress, but it is not a disease itself. Superoxide dismutase is an enzyme that helps protect the body from oxidative damage, so it is not a disease either. Therefore, no diseases are mentioned in the paragraph.
